docs.snippet: The move fulfilled a promise made in the State of the Union address....
docs.lead_paragraph: The move fulfilled a promise made in the State of the Union address.

headline.main: Obama Raises Minimum Wage for Contract Workers

docs.snippet: The Obama administration announced that it would again delay the mandate for employers to provide health insurance to employees, giving medium-size companies extra time to comply....
docs.lead_paragraph: The Obama administration announced that it would again delay the mandate for employers to provide health insurance to employees, giving medium-size companies extra time to comply.
docs.abstract: Obama administration says it will postpone enforcement of federal requirement for medium-size employers to provide health insurance to employees and allow larger employers more flexibility in how they provide coverage; delay is latest in series of policy changes, extensions and clarifications by administration, and draws new round of criticism from congressional Republicans.

headline.main: Further Delays for Employers in Health Law
headline.print_headline: Further Delays for Employers in Health Law

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

docs.snippet: The Obama administration is to announce the creation of seven regional hubs to help farmers better respond to climate disasters....
docs.lead_paragraph: The Obama administration is to announce the creation of seven regional hubs to help farmers better respond to climate disasters.
docs.abstract: Obama administration announces creation of seven regional 'climate hubs' to help farmers and rural communities respond to the risks of climate change, including drought, invasive pests, fires and floods; White House officials describe the move as one of several purely executive actions that President Obama will take on climate change.

headline.main: White House Announces 7 Regional Climate Hubs
headline.print_headline: White House Announces 7 Regional Climate Hubs

docs.snippet: President Obama has moved toward the Republicans, and voters, in his choice of words when discussing the economy....
docs.lead_paragraph: President Obama has moved toward the Republicans, and voters, in his choice of words when discussing the economy.
docs.abstract: Washington Memo; Pres Obama has moved toward Republicans, and voters, in his choice of words when discussing the economy, emphasizing opportunity and upward mobility instead of income inequality and wealth redistribution.

headline.main: In Talk of Economy, Obama Turns to ‘Opportunity’ Over ‘Inequality’
headline.print_headline: Obama Moves to the Right in a Partisan War of Words

docs.snippet: As the economy shrugged off the effects of the government shutdown and debt standoff, economists said President Obama faced an uphill battle to burnish his economic legacy before leaving office....
docs.lead_paragraph: As the economy shrugged off the effects of the government shutdown and debt standoff, economists said President Obama faced an uphill battle to burnish his economic legacy before leaving office.
docs.abstract: Commerce Department reports that the economy grew by 3.2 percent in the final quarter of 2013, providing White House with further evidence of 'breakout year' Pres Obama cited in State of the Union address; expansion is nonetheless unlikely to match gains under his two predecessors, threatening his legacy.

headline.main: Economy Is Expanding, but Obama’s Legacy May Be Slipping Away
headline.print_headline: Economy Is Expanding, but Obama’s Legacy May Be Slipping Away

docs.snippet: The Supreme Court granted an injunction sought by an order of Roman Catholic nuns who object to the requirement to cover contraception....
docs.lead_paragraph: The Supreme Court granted an injunction sought by an order of Roman Catholic nuns who object to the requirement to cover contraception.
docs.abstract: Supreme Court extends temporary order from Justice Sonia Sotomayor barring the Obama administration from enforcing the contraception coverage requirement of the Affordable Care Act against an order of Roman Catholic nuns; federal rules issued under the health law require most employers to provide insurance coverage for contraception; nuns say requirement is offensive to their religious beliefs.

headline.main: In Nuns’ Suit, Justices Block Key Mandate in Health Law
headline.print_headline: In Nuns’ Suit, Justices Block Key Mandate in Health Law

docs.snippet: In 2007, Barack Obama described a surveillance state run amok. He is now the leader of a surveillance state that some of his own advisers think has gotten out of control....
docs.lead_paragraph: In 2007, Barack Obama described a surveillance state run amok. He is now the leader of a surveillance state that some of his own advisers think has gotten out of control.
docs.abstract: Pres Obama, as a young lawmaker, vowed to rein in a surveillance state run amok and now he presides over a surveillance state that some of his advisers think is once again out of control; his speech at Justice Dept will defend government spying even as he adjusts it to address wave of public concern over civil liberties.

headline.main: Obama’s Path From Critic to Overseer of Spying
headline.print_headline: Obama’s Path From Critic to Overseer of Spying
